instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message:
First issue was, that it didnt turn on. Usual 5v stuff. After replacing <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> it turns on and works fine. It charges with no problem. 
But once i hook an Usb-c to USB3.0 adapter up and connect an extrenal drivee to it. It gets no power. My usb-c dongle has an usb-c power port. if i connect the power supply there the exterenal drive gets recognized.
i have no idea what the cause could be.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message:
The machine still works?
External device is recognized if you work on battery alone?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message: the machine works just fine. On battery it does the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message: if i just connect an usb-c drive with no external powersupply. (or usb-c stick) it does not get recognized

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message: Did you check with an USB device connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message:
Be sure <RESISTOR>R4666</RESISTOR> is good.
If yes, change <CHIP>U4650</CHIP>.

threads.message: cant i just make a connection and set the Enable high ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on, but USB device has no power
threads.message:
Ooops, didn't see already changed.
Should be a problem with <SIGNAL>HPM_SCL</SIGNAL>/SDA bus.
Try changing <CHIP>U4780</CHIP>.
